TikTok 今天宣布了一个新的 API，可让您从批准的第三方应用程序直接向该平台发布内容（并执行其他操作）。该公司表示，这项新功能是Share 到 TikTok的扩展，“增加了我们社区可以选择的资源和工具，以便轻松导航平台内外创作过程的每个阶段。” Direct Post API 的早期合作伙伴包括 Adob​​e、Twitch、Blackmagic Design（ Davinci Resolve的制造商）等。

TikTok Direct Post 集成将允许创作者制作草稿、设置字幕或受众设置，以及直接从受支持的第三方应用程序安排或发布内容。发布时仅支持视频，但照片内容“即将推出”。

支持该功能的第三方软件包括Adob​​e Premiere Pro 、 Adobe Express 、 CapCut （TikTok 母公司字节跳动旗下）、DaVinci Resolve、SocialPilot 和Twitch 。 TikTok 表示，开发者合作伙伴将“通过审核流程进行审查”，然后才能使用该 API。

Adobe 创意云营销副总裁 Deepa Subramaniam 表示：“现在，实时发布内容比以往任何时候都更加必要，各种技能水平的创作者都需要能够提高效率且不受限制的工具。” “借助 Adob​​e Express 和 Premiere Pro 中针对 TikTok 提供的新 Direct Post 功能，创作者可以继续创作出色的内容，但速度会更快，而且不会对其创作工作流程造成更多干扰。”

Adobe 高管在周二的 Adob​​e Max 2023 活动上宣布，在Beta 版首次亮相仅 7 个月后，Adobe 的Firefly 生成人工智能将获得三款新模型以及 100 多项新特性和功能。 Firefly Image 2 模型为用户提供了更高保真度的生成图像和更精细的控制，而 Vector 模型将允许图形设计师快速生成矢量图像，这在业界尚属首次。用于生成印刷和在线广告布局的设计模型提供了另一个第一：文本到模板的生成。

Adobe 在其产品中使用机器学习并不陌生。该公司于 2016 年发布了最早的商业人工智能 Sensei。Firefly 构建在 Sensei 系统之上，为图像和视频编辑人员提供了一整套人工智能工具和功能，从“文本到颜色增强”饱和度和色调调整到字体和设计元素生成，甚至动态创建背景音乐并将其合并到视频场景中。生成式 AI 套件可在 Adob​​e 的产品生态系统中使用，包括 Premiere Pro、After Effects、 Illustrator、Photoshop 和 Express ，以及所有订阅级别的 Creative Cloud 平台（是的，甚至是免费的）。

Firefly Image 2 是现有文本到图像系统的更新版本。与它的前身一样，它专门针对许可和公共领域的内容进行了培训，以确保其输出图像可安全用于商业用途。它还支持 100 种语言中任意一种的文本提示。

Adobe 的人工智能已经可以跨模式工作，从静态图像、视频和音频到设计元素和字体效果。截至周二，由于新的 Firefly 矢量模型，它还可以生成矢量艺术。目前该新模型处于测试阶段，还将提供生成匹配功能，它将在其输出图像中重新创建给定的艺术风格。这将使用户能够遵守品牌指南，使用现有图像及其美学以及无缝、可平铺的填充图案和矢量渐变快速启动新设计。

最后一个设计模型主要面向广告和营销专业人士，用于使用 Adob​​e Express 生成打印和在线复制模板。用户将能够在 Firefly 中生成图像，然后将它们移植到表达式中，以便在根据用户的自然语言提示生成的布局中使用。这些模板可以以任何流行的宽高比生成，并且可以通过传统的数字方法完全编辑。

Firefly Web 应用程序还将获得三个新功能： 生成匹配（如上所述），用于在图像和资产之间保持一致的设计美学。照片设置将生成更加真实的图像（想想：可见的、定义的毛孔），并使用户能够使用景深、模糊和视野等摄影指标来调整图像。据报道，在这种设置下，系统对植物叶子的描绘也将得到改善。提示指导甚至可以将您想出的任何陈词滥调的散文重写为实际可行的内容，从而减少大规模重新生成提示图像的需要。

很少有科技公司像 Adob​​e 那样全心全意地拥抱生成式人工智能。在 Adob​​e Max 年度创意大会上，它推出了新版本的 Firefly GAI 模型。不仅如此，在Firefly 在应用程序中更广泛地提供几周后，该公司还宣布了 Adob​​e Express 的更多 GAI 功能。

Adobe Express 现在包含生成填充等功能。这使得用户能够使用文本提示添加、删除或替换项目、人物和图像的其他方面。同样，文本到模板功能可以帮助用户根据文本描述生成可编辑的模板，例如图形和社交媒体帖子等。 Text to Template 由新的 Firefly 设计模型提供支持，Adobe 表示该模型将生成可安全用于商业用途的内容。

最重要的是，Express 现在提供了由 GAI 支持的翻译工具。 Adobe 表示，Translate 可以本地化 45 种语言之间的内容。同时，新的绘图和绘画功能支持 50 多种多色颜料和装饰画笔。它们可以模仿木炭、铅笔和水彩等纹理。该公司还指出，Express for Education 中提供的适合学生的绘图模板可以轻松创建花朵和心形等效果。

Adobe 表示，方便的调整大小工具将使人们能够轻松自动获取设计的多个版本以适应所有社交渠道。同时，您将能够使用该应用程序直接安排视频并将其分享到 TikTok、Instagram、Facebook、LinkedIn、Pinterest 和 X 等平台。

Adobe并没有完全停止使用 Express。 Max 在其主要 Adob​​e Creative Cloud 应用程序中宣布了 100 多项新功能。其中包括适用于 Illustrator 和 Photoshop 的额外 Firefly 支持工具，以及 Lightroom 中的新编辑功能。

A request to create a flyer for "Real Estate Open House" led to the generative AI creating four template options. Sony Inzone Buds hands-on: A slick, gamer-focused twist on the WF-1000XM5

去年，索尼以其 Inzone 品牌发布了第一条专用游戏外设系列，其中包括几个显示器和一系列耳罩式耳机。现在，索尼带着一对新的耳塞和中档耳机的更新回归，对于考虑升级音频的游戏玩家来说值得考虑。

索尼更便携的产品简称为 Inzone Buds，它们使用与备受推崇的WF-1000XM5相同的驱动器，因此当我说它们听起来很棒时，您可能不会感到惊讶。您还可以获得对索尼出色的主动降噪技术和方便的环境声音模式的支持，但从那里开始，耳机的功能进行了调整，以更好地优化游戏时的音质。

除了与 PS5 有明显联系的更新设计外，Inzone Buds 与 WF-1000XM5 最大的区别在于它的外壳。它是一个相对较大的梯形，打开后可以看到耳机本身和无线音频适配器。在日常耳塞中包含适配器有点不寻常，但在游戏外设中更为常见，因为它提供专用的低延迟 2.4GHz 无线连接（延迟低于 30 毫秒），以确保脚步声和其他音频提示等声音及时敲响你的耳朵。该加密狗甚至还包括一个用于 PC 或 PS5/移动设备的开关，以进一步简化操作，不过您也可以依靠标准蓝牙连接。

除了在游戏时提供更高质量的声音之外，我发现该适配器非常方便。当在手机上听音乐时，延迟不是一个大问题，我很高兴使用蓝牙。但当我坐在 PC 或 PS5 前时，切换音频源就像将适配器插入空闲的 USB-C 端口一样简单。作为 PS5 用户的另一个好处，耳机可以让你直接在控制台的 UI 中查看电池电量或音量等信息，这通常是为 PlayStation 品牌的外设保留的。请记住，这些耳机是由索尼电子公司（制造电视、扬声器和其他小工具的公司）制造的，而不是索尼互动娱乐公司（PlayStation 制造商）制造的。

您可以使用索尼的 360 Spatial Sound Personalizer 应用程序根据您的耳道定制音频。也就是说，根据我的经验，这种影响远不如索尼的耳罩式耳机那么明显，因为索尼的耳罩式耳机占据了整个耳朵的形状。不过，您可以在 Inzone Hub 应用程序中进一步调整耳机的声音个性化。我喜欢的是添加了新的基于人工智能的降噪功能，可以过滤掉通话过程中分散注意力的声音，这非常有用，尤其是当您在电脑上玩游戏并使用响亮的机械键盘时。得益于对空间音频的支持，您可以获得 3D 声场，可以帮助您在射击游戏中判断敌人何时会偷袭您。

通过蓝牙连接时，充电后电池续航时间长达 24 小时（使用 2.4GHz 时约为 12 小时），索尼声称 Inzone 耳机的续航时间是所有真正的无线游戏耳塞中最长的。使用它们一个周末后，这个数字似乎是正确的。当电量最终耗尽时，充电盒只需五分钟即可补充一小时的电量，同时保持足够的电量进行第二次完全充电。

也就是说，虽然我总体上喜欢 Inzone 耳机，但我还是有一些抱怨。首先是该保护壳不支持无线充电，这对于 200 美元的耳机来说似乎是一个奇怪的遗漏。此外，与更典型的耳塞相比，这款耳机的外壳相当笨重，当你考虑到它的梯形形状时，有些人可能会怀疑你是否在口袋里藏了一只兔子。另一个小挫折是，虽然您可以使用 PC 上的 Inzone Hub 软件来调整各种设置，但没有等效的移动应用程序。这意味着，如果您在城里散步并且想要调整 Inzone Buds 的触摸控制，则必须等到回家。

有趣的是，如果你像我一样，由于便携性而通常更喜欢耳塞而不是大耳机，那么拥有同样擅长游戏和一般音频的小型耳机会很好。 Inzone 耳机的售价为 200 美元，比 WF-1000XM5 便宜 100 美元，对于同时关心两者的人来说，这是一个有趣的选择。

除了新的耳塞外，Inzone 系列的另一个更新是新的 150 美元 H5 耳机，它是旧的、更昂贵的 229 美元 H7 耳机的新中端替代品。尽管成本低了 80 美元，但 H5 拥有更好的麦克风，这要归功于与耳机相同的基于人工智能的降噪技术，以及对有线和无线音频的支持（H7 仅支持无线）以及稍微轻巧的设计。唯一的代价是整体电池续航时间从 40 小时缩短至 28 小时。

Inzone Buds 和 Inzone H5 耳机现已上市，售价分别为 200 美元和 150 美元。

上周，当 Gmail 在 Wear OS 上推出时，人们想知道配套的 Google 日历应用程序还要等多久才能推出。嗯，就在这里。正如9to5Google最初发现的那样，Google 日历已正式支持 Wear OS，让智能手表佩戴者能够以各种方式访问​​他们的日常日程。

安装后，您将在启动器上看到它作为日历。它基本上是手机上日程视图的增强版本。当您打开该应用程序时，您会发现一个每日日历，其中包含事件、笔记、通知等的精确位置详细信息。除了完全删除活动之外，您还可以调整是否参加任何已保存的活动。

如果您厌倦了盯着小小的智能手表屏幕，您还可以使用日历应用程序打开智能手机上的任何日期或事件。某些事件（例如假期和生日）可以作为背景图像显示在应用程序的主提要中。这里甚至还集成了一些 Google 任务，因此您可以将事件标记为完成。

与许多智能手表应用程序一样，Google 日历是用于消费而非创建的。您不能使用该应用程序来创建新的事件或任务。不过，有两个新的 Wear OS 磁贴可让您快速浏览即将发生的事件和任务，而无需打开完整的应用程序。

适用于 Wear OS 的 Google 日历现已可在 Play 商店下载。只需在 Play 商店的可穿戴版本中搜索日历或通过应用程序列表远程安装即可。

随着 Wear OS 3 和 Wear OS 4 不断获得新功能，该公司较旧的智能手表操作系统正在失去工具。谷歌最近宣布，其专有的语音助手将不再适用于运行 Wear OS 3 之前任何版本的手表。

Today the BBC announced it will finally add every available classic episode of Doctor Who , and all of its spin-offs, to iPlayer. It's the culmination of work which began when Russell T. Davies returned as the show's major creative force, and a significant change for the BBC. In a statement , it said every episode of the classic series, plus spin-offs like The Sarah Jane Adventures , Torchwood and Class , as well as making-of series Doctor Who Confidential , would all be added on November 1st.

All of Doctor Who’s post-2005 revival series are widely-available on streaming services both in the UK and abroad. But the original run has rarely, if ever, been on-demand without an extra charge, as it's still one of the BBC's most reliable cash-cows. The series has been released on VHS, DVD and now Blu-ray, with several of its most recent releases requiring multiple printings. The only place to stream Doctor Who on-demand, at least with a clean conscience, is by paying for BritBox's premium streaming service .

As part of the release, the BBC is making a point of the new accessibility features — including every episode featuring sign language translation — and that a new archive of material will also be put online on the official Doctor Who website. It's not clear, at this point, if this will include the hours upon hours of special documentaries and behind-the-scenes material that comes with the show's numerous DVD and Blu-ray releases.

The change comes as the show builds up to its 60th anniversary later that same month, as the show stops being a purely BBC production. Instead, it's being made by Bad Wolf productions with cash backing from Disney, which will stream the show on Disney+ outside the UK. It's pure speculation on my part, but if the BBC has cleared any issues that prevented it from streaming all of Doctor Who in the UK, then the whole series may also be available on Disney+ at the same time.

While Black Friday is generally the best time to grab a good TV for the lowest price possible, Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days sale — which kicked off today and runs through Wednesday — has brought a few worthwhile discounts for those looking to shop for a new set today. We've sorted out the best TV deals of the “October Prime Day” event below, which include solid prices on LG OLED TVs, Samsung's The Frame TV and well-reviewed budget models from Hisense and TCL. If you want to spruce up your TV with a new media streamer, we've included a handful of deals on those devices as well.

LG C2

The 55-inch LG C2 is down to $1,097, which is $100 more than the lowest price we've seen for the OLED TV but still $100 less than its usual sale price these days. The C2 is a 2022 model, but various reviews suggest that LG's new C3 TV is only a marginal upgrade. The older set still provides the kind of high contrast, wide viewing angles, rich colors and smooth motion you'd expect from a good OLED panel, plus it has four HDMI 2.1 ports capable of playing 4K video at 120Hz. A QD-OLED set like the Samsung S90C will deliver better brightness and color saturation, but the C2 should satisfy if you keep it out of a brightly-lit room. LG's OLED TVs also support Dolby Vision HDR, while Samsung TVs do not.

Samsung S90C

Speaking of the Samsung S90C , the 55-inch version of that OLED TV is on sale for $1,448. While not cheap, this is an all-time low and about $125 off the TV's average street price. As noted above, the S90C's QD-OLED panel delivers excellent picture quality in most lighting environments, and it has just about all the gaming features expected from a modern set, including four HDMI 2.1 ports that can reach up to 144Hz in 4K. It won't get as bright as the best LED TVs with HDR content, but it'll provide superior contrast, motion handling and viewing angles for those willing to pay a premium.

LG B2

The LG B2 , meanwhile, is down to $847 for a 55-inch model. That's a new low and roughly $150 off its average street price in recent months. The B2 is the step-down model from the C2, as it's not as bright or color-rich with HDR content, it runs on a slower processor and it has two fewer HDMI 2.1 ports. That said, its contrast, colors and motion performance will still be a significant upgrade if you're upgrading from a more basic LED TV. LG's new B3 TV promises a cleaner webOS interface, but it's priced a good way higher as of this writing. If you want an OLED TV for less than $1,000, the B2 should be a better value.

Hisense U8K

The 65-inch Hisense U8K is available for $998, which ties the lowest price we've seen and comes in about $100 below its usual going rate. The 55-inch model is available for $200 less. This is one of Hisense's new TVs for 2023, and various reviews say it's one of the better values in the mid-priced bracket, with impressive brightness and good contrast for an LED panel. It runs the easy-to-use Google TV interface and comes with two HDMI 2.1 ports that support 4K at 144Hz. It has other gaming-friendly features like VRR and ALLM too, plus it supports all the major HDR formats. It still won't look as rich or fluid in motion as a good OLED set, and its viewing angles are worse, but the relatively low price should help make up for that.

Hisense U6K

Samsung The Frame TV (LS03B)

Samsung's The Frame TV is down to $998 for a 55-inch set with an included bezel cover. That's a hefty $550 less than this bundle's average street price. Several other sizes are discounted, from the 32-inch model for $548 to the 85-inch set for $3,498. It's designed to look like a piece of art you can mount against a wall, and when you aren't watching something, you can use it to display artwork and photos. A few pieces come included, while others are sold with an optional subscription .

TCL Q6

The 55-inch TCL Q6 is available for $370, which is about $55 off its usual street price and matches the lowest price we've seen. The 65- and 75-inch models are also on sale for $480 and $680, respectively, though neither of those are all-time lows. This budget-level set lacks the local dimming and mini-LED backlight of the Hisense U6K, and recent reviews suggest that it performs worse as a result. The main reason we list it here is because it supports a 120Hz refresh rate — albeit only in 1080p or 1440p, not 4K. But if you can live with the lower resolution, this is a relatively affordable way to get a more fluid image with game consoles like the PS5 and Xbox Series X. TCL S4

The TCL S4 , meanwhile, is down to $250 for a 55-inch set and $380 for a 65-inch set . Both discounts represent all-time lows. The Roku Streaming Stick 4K is available for $38, which isn't an amazing deal — we've seen it drop as low as $25 in the past — but still takes about $7 off the device's usual street price. Roku's UI is blander than competing options from Google, Apple and Amazon, but it remains dead simple to navigate, and its search function does well to find shows across different apps. We also like the Roku app's private-listening feature, which lets you listen to shows through a mobile device. Just note that we may see a better deal on Black Friday.

Roku also sells the $70 Streaming Stick 4K+ , which adds an improved voice remote with a rechargeable battery, a lost remote finder, two custom shortcut buttons, and a headphone jack for private listening without the app. That model isn't on sale as of this writing, however.

The Roku Express 4K+ provides the same general experience as the Streaming Stick 4K, but it can't plug directly into your TV's HDMI port. It also has slightly slower Wi-Fi and lacks support for Dolby Vision HDR. But it's cheaper, and right now it's on sale for $29. That's a few dollars more than its all-time low but roughly $8 below its average street price. If you have a solid internet connection at home and just want to save a few bucks, it could work. For older or secondary TVs, the 1080p Roku Express is also on sale for $22.

The Roku Streambar is down to $100, which is a deal we've seen several times before but still falls about $15 below the device's average street price. This is a 14-inch soundbar that doubles as a 4K media streamer. It's a compact, 2.0-channel model, so it doesn't sound especially clear or powerful, but it's still an obvious upgrade over the speakers built into most TVs. If you're on a tight budget and want to upgrade a smaller TV outside the living room, it's worth a look. Just note that it doesn't support Dolby Vision and HDR10+, though it does work with AirPlay 2. We gave the Streambar a review score of 86 back in 2020.

Amazon Fire TV Cube

Another hybrid-style device, the Amazon Fire TV Cube blends a 4K media streamer with a hands-free Alexa speaker. It's back down to $110, which is $30 off and ties an all-time low. The Cube is Amazon's most powerful Fire TV streamer, and its HDMI pass-through lets you connect a cable box or game console and integrate it with an Alexa overlay. The device also supports Wi-Fi 6E. Fire OS' frequent ads and nudging toward Amazon services may be hard to accept on a pricier device, though. The HDMI input is also limited to 60Hz video.

Amazon Fire TV Stick

Amazon's Fire TV Stick and Fire TV Stick Lite are on sale for $20 and $18, respectively. Neither deal is an all-time low, but both are a few bucks less than their common sale prices. You'd buy one of these dongles if you wanted to add streaming content to an older 1080p TV and frequently use Amazon services like Prime Video. They aren't especially quick, and neither supports Dolby Vision, but they get the job done. Between the two, the standard Fire TV Stick's remote includes app shortcuts and TV controls for volume and power, while the Lite's remote does not. Both provide easy access to Alexa though.

The Fire TV Stick 4K is on sale too — but only the previous-generation model, not one of the refreshed 4K or 4K Max sticks Amazon unveiled in September, so we'd hold off.

X (formerly Twitter ) has made changes to its policy on newsworthy posts to allow more content that would ordinarily violate its rules to remain on the platform. The company made the modifications amid the conflict in and around the West Bank.

Until now, the company would only grant a newsworthiness exception to accounts that had at least 100,000 followers. X has removed that threshold, as TechCrunch reports. The latest version of the policy stipulates that “high profile” accounts are eligible for a newsworthiness exception. The account in question also needs to represent "a current or potential member of a local, state, national or supra-national governmental or legislative body." Only elected officials and government figures have historically been eligible for the exemption.

X's Safety account noted there's been an upswing in daily active users in the region in recent days and that users have posted more than 50 million times about the conflict. The platform said that it was focused on “protecting the conversation on X” as the situation unfolds.

In the past couple of days, we've seen an increase in daily active users on @X in the conflict area, plus there have been more than 50 million posts globally focusing on the weekend's terrorist attack on Israel by Hamas.

As the events continue to unfold rapidly, a cross-company…

— Safety (@Safety) October 10, 2023

“Over the weekend, we updated our Public Interest Policy ,” the company said. “We know that it's sometimes incredibly difficult to see certain content, especially in moments like the one unfolding. In these situations, X believes that, while difficult, it's in the public's interest to understand what's happening in real time.”

X also said it had removed “newly created Hamas-affiliated accounts” and is working with partners to reduce the spread of “terrorist content.” However, the change to the newsworthiness policy could enable more misinformation about the Israel-Hamas conflict (and other issues) to remain on X when it previously would have been yanked.

The company appears to be taking a more hands-off approach to misinformation in general under owner Elon Musk. It's relying more on Community Notes to crowdsource contextual information about posts that may be false or misleading.

According to The Information , X killed off a tool in recent months that helped to tackle coordinated misinformation campaigns by detecting when multiple accounts shared the same piece of potentially doctored or mislabelled media. The company is said to have made that move to cut costs.
